DOCNAME: CASE OF TANRIKULU AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: No violation of Art. 5-1-c;Violation of Art. 5-3;Pecuniary damage - financial awards to two applicants, one claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial awards to all applicants;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in ORG .

CARDINAL . The first and the third applicant are lawyers . The first and the second applicants were members of ORG and the third applicant was the president of the HADEP ORG provincial headquarters at the time of the events .

CARDINAL . Following information received by the gendarmes that there was a meeting related to the ORG in the provincial headquarters of the HADEP ( PERSON ) and the ORG branch of ORG , the police officers at ORG , after receiving authorisation from ORG and a search warrant from the judge at ORG upon the request of the public prosecutor at that ORG on DATE , conducted a search on the LOC and arrested the applicants together with CARDINAL other persons .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were handed over to the gendarmes at ORG .

CARDINAL . According to the report drafted by the gendarmerie on DATE , at the HADEP headquarters , the police seized CARDINAL ERNK ( ORG of GPE ) and ORG flags , a ORG emblem , CARDINAL books and CARDINAL ORG videotapes about the ORG , CARDINAL audio tapes and documents addressed to the Secretary General of ORG . They also found a pistol on one of the suspects .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were brought before the public prosecutor and ORG . The latter ordered their remand in custody .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor at ORG filed an indictment with the latter accusing the applicants and the other suspects of having made propaganda on behalf of the ORG . He requested that the applicants and other detainees be convicted and sentenced for membership of an illegal organisation under LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , taking into account the charges and the evidence against the applicants , ordered their release pending trial .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG acquitted the applicants of all charges . It held that the materials found in the search could have been placed there by anyone and that apart from their statements in custody , which the applicants claimed to have given under duress , there was no evidence to convict them .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the aforementioned judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant filed a petition with ORG under PERSON no . CARDINAL pertaining to the payment of compensation to persons unlawfully arrested or detained . On DATE ORG awarded the applicant an amount of compensation in respect of non - pecuniary damage to compensate the periods he spent in detention . This decision was upheld by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP The relevant domestic law and practice in force at the material time can be found in GPE and Others v. GPE ( nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL and LOC , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , CARDINAL DATE ) and PERSON v. GPE ( no . PERSON , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , DATE ) .
